p: Hedyosmum spp essential oils are known to contain several phenylpropanoids [ 3, 5, 6], sometimes in high amounts, as in essential oil from H. scabrum leaves, which contained 55.8% of estragole and 6.6% of anethole [ 5]. Also, some H. brasiliense specimens from different geographic origins have shown methyl chavicol, eugenol acetate, methyl eugenol, and estragole [ 18, 19, 28]. However, the only phenylpropanoid detected in our study was methyl eugenol, but in small amounts.
